My first Ruby program
Posted on 01 July 2013 in education and programming

A long time ago, I wrote a password generator (called Peewee) using C++. In an effort to learn Ruby, I rewrote the program.

New Password Generator in Ruby

    #!/usr/bin/env ruby
 
def settings_check(setting)
  print "Include #{setting}? (yes or no): "
  user_input = gets.chomp
  abort("Please respond 'yes' or 'no'") unless user_input == 'yes' or user_input == 'no'
  user_input == 'yes' ? true : false
end
 
print 'How many characters? (Your password must be at least 8 characters): '
num_char = gets
abort('Password is not at least 8 characters') unless num_char.to_i >= 8
 
lower = settings_check("lowercase")
upper = settings_check("uppercase")
num = settings_check("numbers")
symb = settings_check("symbols")
 
possible_char = ""
settings = {letters: 'abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz', numbers: '0123456789', symbols: '`~!@#$%^&*()_-+='}
 
possible_char += settings[:letters] if lower
possible_char += settings[:letters].upcase if upper
possible_char += settings[:numbers] if num
possible_char += settings[:symbols] if symb
 
rand_gen = Random.new
password = num_char.to_i.times.map { possible_char[rand_gen.rand(possible_char.size)] }.join
 
print "\n" + password + "\n\n"

Old Password Generator in C++

    /*  Created by: Julia Van Cleve
    Contact: julia@jmv.me"
    Last Updated: May 24, 2010  */
 
#include <iostream>
#include <fstream> // For reading in /dev/random
#include <string>
 
//#include <unistd.h>
 
#include <time.h>
#include <stdlib.h>
 
#define num_choices 3 // Change to increase the number of possible passwords created
 
using std::cout;
using std::cin;
using std::endl;
using std::cerr;
using std::string;
using std::ifstream;
 
int main() {
 
    cout << "********************" << endl;
    cout << "* Peewee Generator *" << endl;
    cout << "********************" << endl;
    cout << endl;
 
    // Keeps program on a loop until 'quit' is entered at the ending prompt
    string stop_or_go;
    while (stop_or_go != "quit") {
 
        // Stores resulting passwords for output later
        string choices[num_choices];
 
        // Prompt the user for password criteria
        long long int lower, upper, nums, symb, pwsize;
        cout << "How many characters? ";
        cin >> pwsize;
        cout << "Include lowercase? (1 = yes, 0 = no): ";
        cin >> lower;
        cout << "Include uppercase? (1 = yes, 0 = no): ";
        cin >> upper;
        cout << "Include numbers? (1 = yes, 0 = no): ";
        cin >> nums;
        cout << "Include symbols? (1 = yes, 0 = no): ";
        cin >> symb;
        
        // Error checking user input
        int error_val = 0;
        if (pwsize <= 0) {
            cerr << "Please enter a password size greater than 0" << endl;
            error_val = 1;
        }
        if (lower == 0 && upper == 0 && symb == 0 && nums == 0) {
            cerr << "Please enter '1' for at least one property" << endl;
            error_val = 1;
        }
        if (error_val == 1)
            return 1;
        
        // Formulate list of possible characters
        string possible;
        string lowercase = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz";
        string uppercase = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ";
        string numbers = "0123456789";
        string symbols = "`~!@#$%^&*()_-+=";
        
        if (lower == 1)
                possible += lowercase;
        if (upper == 1)
                possible += uppercase;
        if (nums == 1)
                possible += numbers;
        if (symb == 1)
                possible += symbols;
        
        // Opens random file
        ifstream randomFile;
        randomFile.open("/dev/random");
        if (!randomFile.is_open()) {
            cerr << "Error while opening /dev/random" << endl;
            return 1;
        }
        
        // Creates passwords
        string password;
        int choice_it = 0;
        while(choice_it < num_choices) {
            unsigned char r;
            randomFile >> r;
            int slot = r%possible.size();
            password += possible[slot];
            if (password.size() == pwsize) {
                choices[choice_it] = password;
                password.clear();
                choice_it++;
            }
        }
        
        // Outputs possible passwords
        cout << endl;
        cout << "Password Choices:" << endl;
        for (unsigned int i = 0; i < num_choices; i++)
            cout << choices[i] << endl;
        cout << endl;
        
        // Asks user if they wish to exit or create new passwords
        string command;
        string prompt = "Type 'quit' to exit the program OR 'restart' to restart the program: ";
        cout << prompt;
        cin >> command;
        while (command != "quit" && command != "restart") {
            command.clear();
            cout << prompt;
            cin >> command;
        }
        // Sets stop_or_go to 'quit' and exits program
        if (command == "quit")
            stop_or_go = command;   
        cout << endl; 
    }
    return 0;
}
